text: The great thing in the world is not so much to seek happiness as to earn peace and self-respect.
author: Thomas Huxley

text: Change is certain. Peace is followed by disturbances departure of evil men by their return. Such recurrences should not constitute occasions for sadness but realities for awareness, so that one may be happy in the interim.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: I have never advocated war except as a means of peace.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

text: Although a soldier by profession, I have never felt any sort of fondness for war, and I have never advocated it, except as a means of peace.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

text: To secure peace is to prepare for war.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz
